description:
Very cool, fast and simple. The thing I needed the most is the possibility to make a payment recurrent. 

Would be cool to sync with mobile or a web version.

Not ergonomic enough, you cannot select several transactions and assign them categories or modify them in batches. It gets slow easily or crashy when you have several years of transactions. Its also a bit annoying to have one file = one account = one tab when you have several accounts. So it becomes a waste of time rather than using LibreOffice.
Graph pies gets too small when you have a lot of categories and there should be more graphs available in my opinion.
Even for homebanking not enough even though the interface seems nice at first glance.
as basic as it can be
Need to add categories option for transactions and support different currencies. Hope to see this project growing.

Its very simple but does everything even more right than my on bank does in their overview, the dark theme is nice, the layout is perfect. im really hoping this application takes off. im gonna recommend it to everyone i know!
summary: Cudos to the devs who came up with this one

description: There are no instructions for getting started with this application, hitting 'new account' prompts you to open a file that assumably, the app is meant to create at some point. So you may think, okay, i'll make a new blank file with that extension and see what happens: one 'Savings.nmoney' file later aaaand, crash. This app lools very useful based on the screenshots, but any instructions whatsoever for new users would be a good idea.
I can't start app because create new account not possible
Very good, works as it should.
summary: Works as Intended in Ubuntu 23.04 ARM

description: downloaded this app and i'm still poor but at least i know that i'm poor, 5/5

It does, what it should do, however it really lacks good visualization features. I would like to have a pie charts that shows what categories make up my monthly expenses. Also a line chart, how my account balances changed over 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year, all time (make that a dropdown option). And maybe some more graphs, that have filters, to visualize other aspects. For example a bar charts that shows the income/expenses per month with a red and green bar, that way I could see how much money I made and spent compared to the previous month, visually. Otherwise, decent application.
Works great but as another reviewer said, the functionality of the app would skyrocket if their were some visualization features. I like the app despite that though.
Great app for managing finances, great design
I tried the Snap version first but it had a bunch of missing and broken icons on Kubuntu. The flatpak did not have this issue. Otherwise it is a very pretty and functional finances app!
I wanted to set my nations currency but still keep switching to USD.
Ich nutze Denaro jetzt schon etwas länger, und ich muss sagen, dass es sowohl grafisch als auch funktionel die beste und schönste App ist, wenn es darum geht, ein Haushaltsbuch zu führen.
